Nonbreeding adult (American).description: Adult Herring Gulls have a paler gray back than Western Gulls. Nonbreeding adult Herrings also have more streaking on their head than nonbreeding adult Western Gulls.

Second winter (American).description: Herring Gulls have a slimmer bill than Western Gulls, which have a more bulbous-shaped bill. Second winter gulls have paler gray feathers coming in on their back than second winter Western Gulls.

Juvenile (American).description: Herring Gulls have a slimmer and less bulbous-tipped bill than Western Gulls in all ages. Juveniles tend to be paler brown overall than juvenile Western Gulls.

Breeding adult.description: Adult California Gulls can be separated from adult Western Gulls by their yellow legs and paler gray backs.

Second winter.description: Second winter California Gulls have a slimmer and more strongly bicolored bill than second winter Western Gulls. At this age, the back feathers are also paler on California than on Western Gulls.

First winter.description: The bill on first winter California Gulls is more strongly bicolored than the bill on first winter Western Gulls. Californias also tend to have whiter heads than first winter Westerns.

Juvenile.description: Juvenile California Gulls have a slimmer bill that usually shows pink at the base while the bill of juvenile Western Gulls is entirely black and heavier.

Nonbreeding adult.description: Adult Ring-billed Gulls can be separated from adult Western Gulls by their smaller size, paler gray backs, yellow legs, and black band around the bill.

First winter.description: Immature Ring-billed Gulls are smaller than Western Gulls and have a slimmer bill, lacking the bulbous tip seen on immature Westerns.

Nonbreeding adult.description: Adult Glaucous-winged Gulls have pale gray wingtips unlike adult Western Gulls that have black wingtips. Glaucous-winged Gulls are also paler gray overall than Western Gulls.

Second winter.description: Immature Glaucous-winged Gulls have paler brown wingtips than immature Western Gulls.
